name: Duffel
description:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.

Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.

That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.

We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.

Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Steve Domin
team.bioHtml: CEO & co-founder @Duffel. Previously @GoCardless.

team.name: Tom Bates
team.bioHtml: Designer from LDN. Living in São Paulo. Previously made things at places such as @Palantir Technologies, @ustwo, and @GoCardless.

jobs.title: Business Development Manager
jobs.description:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.

Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.

That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.

We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.

Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.


Business Development at Duffel

As the Business Development (BD) function of a young startup, we have so much ground to cover, so much opportunity to tap. We are responsible for steering Duffel's commercial strategy and success. That includes seeking new markets, new clients, growing bookings and building strong relationships with existing clients. We are champions for our clients to ensure our products bring meaningful value to their businesses.


What we're looking for in you

- You have a skillset combining elements of strategic planning, sales, operations and entrepreneurship - bringing these together, you'll bring Duffel into new markets and to new clients.
- You have a strategic mind, and you're a do-er. You work on commercial strategy & planning, and also form & execute plans against these.
- You're experienced and comfortable through all stages of the acquisition funnel; from lead generation to deal-making, onboarding to relationship management.
- A "Launcher" approach to problem solving. You're able to navigate past roadblocks that come with new markets & businesses (eg. local regulation, sales ops, pricing models).
- You'll be employee #1 in the US! You have to be comfortable working independently whilst staying aligned to overall strategy and Team HQ.
- An empathetic & big picture BD approach. Championing delivering long term value to clients.
- A flexibility & willingness to travel frequently. You'll be spending time in our London HQ as well as industry events & conferences.
- Previous experience engaging and managing the C-level would be a BIG plus.


What you'll be doing

- Commercial strategy & planning, primarily for the US market. You'll research & map out the key States, clients and relationships needed to successfully bring Duffel to the US market.
- Working closely with HQ on deciding the best go-to-market strategy & tactics (channels, pricing, business model etc.).
- Independently managing the full acquisition funnel (lead generation, deal-making, onboarding, relationship management).
- Bringing back client feedback/insights to help our team build better products.
- You'll be Duffel's brand ambassador in the US (and beyond), being present at industry events & conferences raising awareness of Duffel throughout.
- Streamlining processes; from BD to operations, to client support.


What you can expect from us

We're dedicated to your personal growth. Our environment is comfortable both physically, but also in that our ears are always open to any ideas, concerns and questions. We believe that everyone should have pride in their work, taking full ownership of it and its impact. That's why everyone who joins Duffel owns a share of the company.


We are an equal opportunities employer. We believe that the key to our success is employing a diverse team, that's why recruitment decisions are only based on your experience and skills. We value your ability to problem solve and build amazing things so we welcome applications for everyone – regardless of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

We are an equal opportunities employer. We believe that the key to our success is employing a diverse team, that's why recruitment decisions are only based on your experience and skills. jobs.title: Data Engineer
jobs.description:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.  
Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.  
That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.   
We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed by Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.  
Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.  
Data at Duffel  
The team is in charge of all data-related questions, and its mission is to leverage data into an asset across the entire organisation. As analysts, scientists, or engineers, we are responsible for the entire lifecycle: from its collection to its analysis, from its aggregation to the productisation of complex models.  
As a data-engineer, you will mainly be working on building and managing Duffel's processing infrastructure, in order to enable data-driven decision making and feed data-science algorithms.  
You will mainly be working with Python & Elixir, and will use state of the art technologies (Airflow, Neo4j, Kubernetes, Terraform, the Google Cloud Suite - with PubSub, GCS, BigQuery, DataStore, DataFlow, etc).

jobs.title: Open Application
jobs.description:

We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.

Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.

If our story & mission resonates with you but you've not seen the right job on our careers page, please get in touch.

Tell us about yourself, what you've worked on and what you'd like to do at Duffel. We're growing fast and new opportunities are always on the horizon so we love talking with great people who can bring something new to the team. Who knows, you could end up finding out about a new job at Duffel before anyone else :-)

jobs.title: Site Reliability Engineer
jobs.description:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.  
Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.  
That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.   
We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed by Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.  
Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.  
Engineering at Duffel  
We're a small team building tools to simplify travel distribution, search and booking. What does this actually mean? It's one common and seamless API. This brings huge technical challenges as we need to design and build a beautiful API before integrating to hundreds of airlines. Along with that we need to navigate through the differing needs and systems of each airline whilst building a fantastic developer experience to go with it.  
The tools used on the team include Elixir, Phoenix, Kubernetes, Terraform, PostgreSQL and more from Google Cloud Platform.  
You'll be working with the rest of our engineering team but you'll be the first dedicated Site Reliability Engineer at Duffel.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Backend
jobs.description:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.

Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.

That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.

We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.

Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.


Engineering at Duffel

We're a small team building tools to simplify travel distribution, search and booking. What does this actually mean? It's one common and seamless API. This brings huge technical challenges as we need to design and build a beautiful API before integrating to hundreds of airlines. Along with that we need to navigate through the differing needs and systems of each airline whilst building a fantastic developer experience to go with it.

The tools used on the team include Elixir, Phoenix, Kubernetes and Google Cloud Platform.

What we're looking for in you
- A passion for designing and building fantastic API's, delivering great developer experiences to go with it.
- An interest in working with Elixir, this is what we mostly work with. Previous experience isn't necessary and learning on the job is absolutely fine. What's more important is your general engineering ability rather than your knowledge of a particular language or framework.
- A high bar in code quality and API design.
- Opinions on what good engineering standards and processes look like as we define ours at Duffel.
- Big picture thinking - you can make trade offs on technical work streams against business impact.
- Fantastic communication skills. You're able to articulate what you're working on and why to the team in a clear and structured way.
- You thrive in a collaborative environment. You believe in your own methods but keep an open mind, taking suggestions and feedback onboard as well.

What you can expect from us

We’re dedicated to your personal growth. Our environment is comfortable physically, but also in that our ears are always open to any ideas, concerns and questions. We believe that everyone should have pride in their work, taking full ownership of it and its impact. That’s why everyone who joins Duffel owns a share of the company.

We are an equal opportunities employer. We believe that the key to our success is employing a diverse team, that’s why recruitment decisions are only based on your experience and skills. We value your ability to problem solve and build amazing things so we welcome applications for everyone – regardless of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.

jobs.title: Software Engineer, Frontend
jobs.description:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.

Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.

That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.

We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.

Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.


Engineering at Duffel

We're a small team working on a user facing product beyond our API. We build the products travel booking companies use to search and sell flights. These products are yet to be modernised so we've a huge opportunity to build beautiful interfaces for businesses using Duffel, in a way they've not experienced before. We truly believe we can set a new standard with this.

The tools used on the team include React, Node, NextJS and Typescript.

What we're looking for in you

-Experience building beautiful, clean and intuitive products with React.
- A customer led approach to your work. You understand and empathise with customers, advocate for their needs and ensure we're building the right solutions to their problems.
- A high bar for code quality and user experience.
- Opinions on what good engineering standards and processes look like as we define ours at Duffel.
- Big picture thinking - you can make trade offs on technical work streams against business impact.
- Fantastic communication skills. You're able to articulate what you're working on and why to the team in a clear and structured way.
- You thrive in a collaborative environment. You believe in your own methods but keep an open mind, taking suggestions and feedback onboard as well.

What you can expect from us

We’re dedicated to your personal growth. Our environment is comfortable physically, but also in that our ears are always open to any ideas, concerns and questions. We believe that everyone should have pride in their work, taking full ownership of it and its impact. That’s why everyone who joins Duffel owns a share of the company.

We are an equal opportunities employer. We believe that the key to our success is employing a diverse team, that’s why recruitment decisions are only based on your experience and skills. We value your ability to problem solve and build amazing things so we welcome applications for everyone – regardless of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.
jobs.descriptionHtml:
We are making travel effortless. Join us.

Whether it’s to visit the people closest to us, starting an exciting adventure, or a career-defining business trip, travel is an essential part of our lives. Yet we've all experienced the aches and pains of getting to our destination. Today, more than 4 billion airline passengers rely on technology that hasn't kept up with the expectations of the modern connected traveller.

That’s why we’ve started to rebuild the infrastructure that underpins the travel industry. We’re on a mission to unravel travel — simplifying systems and building the tools that will make the future of travel effortless.

We were part of Y Combinator S18's cohort and we are backed Benchmark, Blossom, Index Ventures and Kima Ventures. A fantastic set of investors that has helped build some of the world's largest companies.

Our team in London is growing and we’re looking for talented people to join us on our journey.

Engineering at Duffel

We're a small team working on a user facing product beyond our API. We build the products travel booking companies use to search and sell flights. These products are yet to be modernised so we've a huge opportunity to build beautiful interfaces for businesses using Duffel, in a way they've not experienced before. We truly believe we can set a new standard with this.

The tools used on the team include React, Node, NextJS and Typescript.

What we're looking for in you

-Experience building beautiful, clean and intuitive products with React.

  • A customer led approach to your work. You understand and empathise with customers, advocate for their needs and ensure we're building the right solutions to their problems.
  • A high bar for code quality and user experience.
  • Opinions on what good engineering standards and processes look like as we define ours at Duffel.
  • Big picture thinking - you can make trade offs on technical work streams against business impact.
  • Fantastic communication skills. You're able to articulate what you're working on and why to the team in a clear and structured way.
  • You thrive in a collaborative environment. You believe in your own methods but keep an open mind, taking suggestions and feedback onboard as well.

What you can expect from us

We’re dedicated to your personal growth. Our environment is comfortable physically, but also in that our ears are always open to any ideas, concerns and questions. We believe that everyone should have pride in their work, taking full ownership of it and its impact. That’s why everyone who joins Duffel owns a share of the company.

We are an equal opportunities employer. We believe that the key to our success is employing a diverse team, that’s why recruitment decisions are only based on your experience and skills. We value your ability to problem solve and build amazing things so we welcome applications for everyone – regardless of age, sex, disability, sexual orientation, race, religion or belief.
